usefulItems: square cake tin (20 cm), baking paper, plastic wrap, refrigerator
title: White chocolate fudge

ingredients.content: 200 g white chocolate, broken into pieces

preparations.content: Line base and sides of a square cake tin (20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Place condensed milk, butter, brown sugar, glucose syrup and golden syrup into mixing bowl and cook <b>30 min/100Â°C/speed 3<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid (see Tips).
Add chocolate and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Quickly and carefully pour mixture into prepared tin and smooth the surface. Set aside for 30 minutes at room temperature.
Cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator until firm enough to cut into small squares (approx. 2 hours). Serve once firm.

hintsAndTricks: Test mixture after 30 minutes of cooking by dropping a small amount of condensed milk mixture into cold water. It must form a soft, flexible ball. When you remove the ball from the water, it will flatten like a pancake after a few moments in your hand. If the mixture does not form the ball, cook for a further 2 minutes. If this stage is not reached, the fudge will not set enough to be cut.
You can store fudge in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
